intro: Kohleria papillosa var. solitaria, commonly known as the solitary kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
